## Requirement 1

In this question, we are asked the three forms of business organizations.

First, **Sole Proprietorship** this is a type of a business organization owned and managed by one individual only. It is the simplest legal form of a business. The profits and losses by the business is a personal gain or burden to the sole proprietor.

Second, **Partnership** is a type of a business organization wherein two or more persons bind themselves together and contribute money, property or industry with the intention of dividing the profit or lossess of the business among themselves.

Third, **Corporation** is the biggest form among the three business organization. It is a artificial being that is separate from the owners. It has its own rights, power, attributes and properties expressly authorized by law during its existence.

## Requirement 2

In this question, we are asked the advantages and disadvantages of organizing a sole proprietorship and partnership.

The following are the primary **advantages** of a Sole Proprietorship:

First, the owner of sole proprietorship keeps all the profit of the business.

Second, sole proprietorships are inexpensive and easy to form. 

Thirds, it is also less regulated.

The following are the primary **disadvantages** of a Sole Proprietorship:

First, the owner is personally liable to the business creditors. The extent of the liability of the business extends to the personal assets of the owner. If the business's assets is not enough to pay all the obligations to third parties, the personal asset of the owner will be exhausted.

Second, the ownership is difficult to transfer since it requires the sales of the entire business to a new owner.

The following are the primary **advantages** of a Partnership:

First, it is easy to obtain additional capital for the partnership than a sole proprietorship because of the combined personal credit of each partners

Second, there is a closer supervision on the business since there are more than one person who can manage the partnership activities.

The following are the primary **disadvantages** of a Partnership:

First, a general partner is personally liable to creditors if the partnership assets is not enough to settle all obligations.

Second, there is a divided authority among all the partners. Before undertaking partnership activities or decisions, all partners must have an agreement.

## Requirement 3

In this requirement, we are asked to differentiate general and limited partnership.

A **general partnership** is one wherein **ALL** the partners have unlimited liability to partnership creditors. Their liabilities extend up to their personal property. If the partnership assets are not enough upon liquidation, their personal assets will be exhausted to satisfy the firms' obligations.

A **limited partnership** is one wherein there is more than one or more general partners and one or more limited partners. A limited partner is only bound to the obligations of the partnership up to the capital they contributed. They are not required to furnish their personal assets upon partnership liquidation if the partnership assets is not enough to settle all obligations.

## Requirement 4

In this question, we are asked the reason behind why a corporation is the best when raising cash among the three types of business organizations.

Corporation is said to be superior in raising cash since they have different ways in doing so. 

First is by *borrowing*, a corporation is a separate legal entity so it is treated like an individual who can borrow money from banks or other financial institutions. 

Second, is by *issuing equity capital*, a corporation can sell shares or stocks to the public to increase their capital. Buyer of shares are called stockholders that are compensated by the corporation by issuing dividends. 

Lastly, is by the *net earnings from operation*, the day-to-day activities of a corporation generates income resulting to a cash inflow to the company.
In this problem, we will learn about the different form of business organization.
a. The three forms of business organization are: 1.) **Sole proprietorship**; 2.) **Partnership**; and 3.) **Corporation**.
1.) **Sole proprietorship** is a business structure owned by an individual who exclusively owns all assets and profits of the business.
2.) **Partnership** is a formal arrangement where parties agree to manage and operate a business and share its profits.
3.) **Corporation** is a legal entity created by law which is separate and distinct from its owners.

b. The advantages of sole proprietorships and partnerships are easier to form, has complete control over the business, there's no need to pay any individual income taxes, and the owners will get all profits.

The disadvantages of sole proprietorships and partnerships are unlimited liability for any business debts for the owners and limited life for the business.

c. In a **limited partnership**, the limited partner is only liable up to the amount of their contribution and not liable for any business debts.

In a **general partnership**, all partners have unlimited liability for any business debts.

d. The **corporate form** is superior  when it comes to raising cash because of the limited liability of business debts, unlimited life of the business, and is relatively easier to transfer ownership.
